discourse_list.title: [ \xf0\x9f\x90\xb3 Also Rock the Vote] How some Large MKR Holders are voting thru Anchorage

content.content: Wanted to Post this for the Maker Community Members who wonder why some of the large Institutional players are not participating in Governance/Voting with their MKR tokens. On last week’s episode of the “Pomp Podcast” – the Co-Founder and President of Anchorage, Diogo Monica, stated the following: “We have clients everywhere from crypto funds. so, some of the largest crypto funds. Think folks like Paradigm, Polychain, A16Z Crypto, all the way to very large institutions like Visa.” When ask how Anchorage clients participate in DeFi? “In fact, institutions thru Anchorage can interact with DeFi, and do. In many different ways. For example, Governance decisions on Maker, Governance Decisions on CELO, they vote directly thru Anchorage. With the same safety we have for their assets.” Hence, many of us have wonder if there is participations by Community Members like A16Z, Polychain, Paradigm, etc.,—and the truth is they are. They just do it differently than most of us. And they don’t post their opinions like we do. And they have their reasons for doing it in this fashion. All in all, I really do believe that We all have the same mission. With that in mind, let’s start giving these  the benefit of the doubt.
content.GPT-summary: The post discusses how some large institutional players are voting through Anchorage and participating in DeFi governance decisions on Maker and CELO. The author encourages the Maker community to give these players the benefit of the doubt and acknowledges that they have their reasons for not posting their opinions publicly. The post does not provide any negative feedback or constructive criticism of the proposal.

content.content: The address of A16Z (edit: there could be othe minor ones) is: https://etherscan.io/token/0x9f8f72aa9304c8b593d555f12ef6589cc3a579a2?a=0x05e793ce0c6027323ac150f6d45c2344d28b6019 It seems like there wasn’t any activity in the last year or so. @flipflopflapdelegate are you sure about this “Achorage news”? The 50k MKR of A16Z are there, visible to everybody’s eyes.
GPT-discussion-categories: None of the topics listed match

content.content: Good point @iammeeoh – the co-founder  of Anchorage was probably referring to Paradigm–active voters–and perhaps Poly as well. But yea, looks like A16Z has been inactive. Although they have funded both Celo and of course, Maker–plus Polychain. If I had to guess–could be because of regulatory reasons? Not sure. Or, maybe they just want the Community to develop the protocol on our own. Which is cool with me… prob not cool with some. What can you do…
